author: Enrique Pena Nieto

text: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.

text: We cannot change absolutely everything in one season.

author: Alison Sweeney
text: I take issue with those who criticize 'The Biggest Loser' for pushing contestants too hard. The whole point is to push them hard. Otherwise, there's no change.

author: Mark Pocan
text: I believe that climate change represents one of the greatest threats to our national security and our planet.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
text: He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.

author: Jeanette Winterson
text: I don't read reviews because by then it's too late - whatever anyone says, the book won't change. It is written.

author: Isaac Asimov
text: It is change, continuing change, inevitable change, that is the dominant factor in society today. No sensible decision can be made any longer without taking into account not only the world as it is, but the world as it will be.

author: Liana Liberato
text: Some people say that they read the first 20 pages, and then decide if they want to do the film or not. But, I have to read the entire thing 'cause anything can change in a script.

author: Michael Burgess
text: With the absence of a flu vaccination last year, I did not take a flu shot; but there is still some immunity that carries over from year to year; but about every 30 years, there is a major change in the genetics of the flu virus.

author: Barbara Kingsolver
text: Small change, small wonders - these are the currency of my endurance and ultimately of my life.

author: Jim Rohn
text: You must take personal responsibility. You cannot change the circumstances, the seasons, or the wind, but you can change yourself. That is something you have charge of.

author: James E. Faust
text: Now, a leader must cause things to happen and lives to be affected. Something should move and change. He must see that those under him do not fail. But it should be done in the Lord's way.

author: Sufjan Stevens
text: My music is just about story telling. I don't have much to say, and I'm not trying to change anyone's mind. I'm just singing through conviction about what I love and what I care about, starting with the very small.

author: Arizona Muse
text: I don't know why my smile has become a signature pose. I think it's a nice change. I think people want to see happiness, so a smile is what can bring that. I didn't make it my trademark on purpose.

author: Malcolm Turnbull
text: China and India will take the global leadership on climate change: they are suffering for it.

author: Lewis Gordon Pugh
text: I think that I was slightly naive. I thought that if I showed people the beauty of the Arctic and the beauty of the polar bears that they would care so much that they would stand up and try to make a change.

author: Simon Mainwaring
text: When people align around shared political, social, economic or environmental values, and take collective action, thinking and behavior that compromises the lives of millions of people around the world can truly change.

author: Gary David Goldberg
text: I like to write scenes in the middle of the night. We could change every word of 'Family Ties' between Monday and Friday.

author: Shashi Tharoor
text: Indian democracy has often been likened to the stately progress of the elephant - ponderous in its gait and reluctant to change course, but not easily swayed from its new path when it does.

author: Tom Rath
text: Wanting a more positive environment isn't enough. You need to do something, and it doesn't require a great deal of effort or some huge change in the way you approach things at work.

author: Claire Tomalin
text: Biographers use historians more than historians use biographers, although there can be two-way traffic - e.g., the ever-growing production of biographies of women is helping to change the general picture of the past presented by historians.

author: Bear Grylls
text: The rules of survival never change, whether you're in a desert or in an arena.

author: Jonny Wilkinson
text: I have no intention of letting this decision change the way that I approach my training and preparation for games, but the time has come for me to realise that I have gone as far as I can go with this England team.

author: Melissa McCarthy
text: I've never felt like I needed to change. I've always thought, 'If you want somebody different, pick somebody else.' But sure, criticism can sometimes still get to me. Some things are so malicious, they knock the wind out of you.

author: Douglas Coupland
text: Human beings are the only animal that thinks they change who they are simply by moving to a different place. Birds migrate, but it's not quite the same thing.

author: George Papandreou
text: This idea that you're a successful tough guy if you evade taxes and deceive the state has got to change.

author: Gary Ross
text: Really, each era has its own false nostalgia. We all put a picket fence up around something. For my generation it was the '50s, and for other generations it will be something else. Change is scary for everyone, as is complexity, contradiction, and an uncertain future.

author: Salman Rushdie
text: The Koran was revealed at a time of great change in the Arab world, the seventh-century shift from a matriarchal nomadic culture to an urban patriarchal system.

author: John Dyer
text: During the winter when the weather is too poor to work outside, I do use drawings and photographs, but I change my work so it is not just a time and place study.

author: Andrew Vachss
text: Journalism is what maintains democracy. It's the force for progressive social change.

author: Anne Wojcicki
text: The reality is that the only way change comes is when you lead by example.

author: David Brock
text: What led to my change of views about the Clintons was working through the research and writing on the book on Hillary.

author: Dennis Weaver
text: It's not an if - we're going to have to change. Oil is simply going to be gone.

author: Nancy Gibbs
text: The Catholic Church is one of the oldest, largest and richest institutions on earth, with a following 1.2 billion strong, and change does not come naturally.

author: Danny Boyle
text: I love that sense of change that you'd get in pop music every three minutes, every four minutes.

author: Sonam Kapoor
text: I don't shoot two films at the same time. I finish one character and get into another character because I change my look for every film. It's difficult, but I enjoy doing that.

author: Joey Santiago
text: People do ask, 'Are you going to embellish this stuff?' I wouldn't change any of my guitar parts.

author: Ana Ivanovic
text: If I make a change to a young kid to play any sport, not only tennis, instead of spending time in front of the TV or computer, that is good. I want to give them a good example: 'Hey, go out and play and see the world.'

author: Katy Perry
text: I think sometimes when children grow up, their parents grow up. Mine grew up with me. We coexist. I don't try to change them anymore, and I don't think they try to change me. We agree to disagree.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
text: All conservatism is based upon the idea that if you leave things alone you leave them as they are. But you do not. If you leave a thing alone you leave it to a torrent of change.

author: Cobi Jones
text: I definitely do like change. I don't know if my hairstyles reflect that, but I don't like the same old thing all the time.

author: Paris Hilton
text: Some people change when they think they're a star or something.

author: Martin Rees
text: The scientific community should work as hard as possible to address major issues that affect our everyday lives such as climate change, infectious diseases and counterterrorism; in particular, 'clean energy' research deserves far higher priority. And science and technology are the prime routes to tackling these issues.

author: Steven Biko
text: In a bid for change, we have to take off our coats, be prepared to lose our comfort and security, our jobs and positions of prestige, and our families... A struggle without casualties is no struggle.

author: Zarin Mehta
text: I think in all cultural organizations there has to be renewal. I'm also of a certain age that someone new can come in with a breath of fresh air. Things change, and I think that's important.

author: Ethan Embry
text: You can't think about things you want to change. Just be yourself.

author: Allyson Schwartz
text: Climate change is real.

author: Kawhi Leonard
text: People in the NBA are just as athletic as you. That's the game. You have to have the change of pace. You have to change speeds to get around people.

author: Ezra Taft Benson
text: The proud do not change to improve, but defend their position by rationalizing. Repentance means change, and it takes a humble person to change.

author: Charles Kuralt
text: It's best to leap into something you know you love. You might change your mind later, but that is the privilege of youth.

author: Ann Voskamp
text: The brave who focus on all things good and all things beautiful and all things true, even in the small, who give thanks for it and discover joy even in the here and now, they are the change agents who bring fullest Light to all the world.

author: Alan Alda
text: 'Never Have Your Dog Stuffed' is really advice to myself, a reminder to myself not to avoid change or uncertainty, but to go with it, to surf into change.

author: Rebecca Ferguson
text: Some people won't like me; that's just human nature. I battled with that for years, trying to please people, but now I haven't got time to win people over! I've got nappies to change!

author: Ron Fournier
text: Close elections tend to break toward the challenger because undecided voters - having held out so long against the incumbent - are by nature looking for change.

author: Guy Finley
text: It isn't something of which most of us are aware, but we human beings are 'marked' with a certain strange feature, and that is: We want to change.

author: Brad Gilbert
text: Because you can't change results - I would change my losses, and I would definitely like to see on-court coaching.

author: Sam Heughan
text: People forget actors can adapt and change their appearance. In this industry, people sometimes cast to type, or as close to type as possible, but actors are a lot more versatile than you think!

author: Jodi Picoult
text: It's certainly my honor to be able to, hopefully, change the world a tiny bit, one mind at a time.

author: Danielle Panabaker
text: I would love a little bit of a change.

author: W. Averell Harriman
text: Roosevelt was the one who had the vision to change our policy from isolationism to world leadership. That was a terrific revolution. Our country's never been the same since.

author: Hugh Jackman
text: I just find the evangelical church too, well, restrictive. But the School of Practical Philosophy is nonconfrontational. We believe there are many forms of Scripture. What is true is true and will never change, whether it's in the Bible or in Shakespeare. It's about oneness.

author: Alain de Botton
text: The idea of a book that can make a change to your life, that can affect your perspective, is a beautiful and great ambition: one that Seneca, Nietzsche and Tolstoy would have sympathised with.

author: Michelle Paver
text: If you get a sense that your writing isn't quite working, change it. Or cut it out. Don't just tell yourself it'll do, because it won't.

author: Mimi Kennedy
text: All humans change. Development is our life. Transition, in labor, is the most painful time. Without change, there's no growth.

author: Francis Chan
text: Churchgoers in America are notorious for jumping into movements, even ideas that are hard to listen to. But when they actually have to change their lifestyle and do something about it, it rarely translates into action.

author: Lizzie Armitstead
text: It's difficult to change things in a positive way.

author: James Hillman
text: I don't think anything changes until ideas change. The usual American viewpoint is to believe that something is wrong with the person.

author: Kate Bernheimer
text: Well documented, the relationship of literature to myth in the Western world has undergone much change over the millennia, as first the age of gods fell away before the notion of a single god, and then, for many people, that single god slipped away, too.

author: Rick Warren
text: Being reminded about the incredible power of God's love, and living as He intended, is the most powerful motivation to change.

author: Josh Billings
text: There are two kinds of fools: those who can't change their opinions and those who won't.

author: Jennifer Granholm
text: If you are tired of partisanship over patriotism, you need to vote for a change in direction.

author: Denise McCluggage
text: Change is the only constant. Hanging on is the only sin.

author: Edgardo Osorio
text: You can wear a beautiful black dress that you've maybe had for years, but if you wear a fun shoe, you can completely change it. Wear something different, something sexy, something strappy, or something with pom poms.

author: Gracia Martore
text: Every day, all of us at Gannett are given the rare and sacred opportunity to affect change for the good in the communities we serve, to make life better for the people who trust us to know them and do right by them.

author: Najib Razak
text: The Arab awakening was driven by youth, organized by technology, and fired by a hunger for political change.

author: Sebastian Vettel
text: If you are out in two races and someone else has a good couple of races, it could change. So all we do is try to get the optimum every time.

author: Frederick Douglass
text: Without a struggle, there can be no progress.

author: Blake Lively
text: I need good friends who can say, 'I love you to death, but you look terrible in that, and you need to change right now.'

author: George Papandreou
text: Politics also means educating people. It's important to speak openly with our fellow Greeks, to tell them what our problems are and that we have to change something.

author: Henry Rollins
text: The only difference between me and others is that they think they can change something with cute little poems, nice cards or embracing trees and being nice to little lapdogs.

author: Rafael Nadal
text: My parents' divorce made an important change in my life. It affected me.

author: Nouriel Roubini
text: Having spent 10 years studying emerging markets, I know that you have patterns repeated over and over again. A bubble is like a fire which needs oxygen to continue... when you see there is no oxygen, things change.

author: Rupert Murdoch
text: Climate change has been going on as long as the planet is here, and there will always be a little bit of it.

author: Lauren Groff
text: I have a feeling that books are a lot like people - they change as you age, so that some books that you hated in high school will strike you with the force of a revelation when you're older.

author: Carrie Mae Weems
text: It's impossible to change the social without changing the personal - you have to put your money where your mouth is. And if you're not making those challenges at home, it's unlikely you'll make them in a larger setting.

author: Frank Zappa
text: No change in musical style will survive unless it is accompanied by a change in clothing style. Rock is to dress up to.

author: James Cash Penney
text: Success cannot come from standstill men. Methods change and men must change with them.

author: Tracy Morgan
text: Yeah, race exists. Racism is still here, and it's doing well. Turn on the news. I don't think me and my comedy can really change that.

author: Tina Brown
text: By the end of 'Game Change,' one feels that the candidates' few happy moments are those when they 'lose it.'

author: Naftali Bennett
text: I don't believe in regime change, certainly not in the Middle East.

author: Arthur Smith
text: The real change that paintings undergo is in the perceptions of the viewer.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
text: Change is inevitable. Change is constant.

author: Wade Davis
text: Change is no threat to culture.

author: James E. Faust
text: Unfortunately, some of our poor choices are irreversible, but many are not. Often, we can change course and get back on the right track.

author: Jeff Bezos
text: What's dangerous is not to evolve.

author: Christopher Lee
text: As far as I am concerned, Don Quixote is the most metal fictional character that I know. Single handed, he is trying to change the world, regardless of any personal consequences.

author: Olga Korbut
text: And I suggested to change very simple way to Olympic Games, in one competition, two different levels. Separate from, until sixteen, and after sixteen years old.

author: Theodore Zeldin
text: We imagine that human nature doesn't change. We like to say that but I don't think it's true because we have, in the course of the centuries, altered ourselves.

author: John Barton
text: In the past, poetry came in the form of spells and chants used to effect change.

author: Bijou Phillips
text: I can't change the world. I have to fix me.

author: Nick Cave
text: Guns are part of the American psyche, aren't they? This is collateral damage for having a Wild West mentality. It's intrinsic to the American psyche. It's never going to change.

author: Ezra Taft Benson
text: Becoming Christlike is a lifetime pursuit and very often involves growth and change that is slow, almost imperceptible.

author: Steve Southerland
text: What is true is that if we do not change the culture of Washington, D.C., the United States of America will cease.

author: Akhenaton
text: Be thou incapable of change in that which is right, and men will rely upon thee. Establish unto thyself principles of action; and see that thou ever act according to them. First know that thy principles are just, and then be thou.

author: Zac Goldsmith
text: The Conservatives are a confusing lot. They first denied climate change was a serious issue and then suggested strengthening the nuclear industry as a solution to it. They oppose the European Union, but support joining North American Free Trade Agreement, despite its obvious failure.

author: Yoko Ono
text: If your life changes, we can change the world, too.

author: Ban Ki-moon
text: I have been very encouraged by President Obama's call to action on climate change both at his Inauguration and in the State of the Union Address. This is a global imperative. I also welcome President Obama's intention to pursue reductions in nuclear arsenals.

author: Nadine Gordimer
text: Time is change; we measure its passing by how much things alter.

author: George M. Church
text: The World Wide Web went from zero to millions of web pages in a few years. Many revolutions look irrelevant just before they change everything swiftly.

author: Thomas McDonell
text: I think there are certain technical things about acting that change between working in film and television. Everything definitely slows down and we have more time in film.

author: David Novak
text: Cultural synthesis is how a compromise between various opinions is worked out. But truth does not change, and truth is not arrived at by some sort of compromise.

author: Larry Flynt
text: There's nothing that will change someone's moral outlook quicker than cash in large sums.

author: Dana Brunetti
text: The future of the television industry is changing at an unstoppable rate, and it is exciting to share my experience and thoughts on how this will change the value of content in the digital space.

author: Jonathan Ive
text: It's easy to think that craft can't change but important to remember that all craft process was at some point new, at some point challenged convention - not to be contrary, but enabled by some breakthrough, some newly discovered principle, or sometimes some wonderful accident.

author: Heraclitus
text: There is nothing permanent except change.

author: Dennis Farina
text: You can change a person's life in an instant; put him in a movie, and you start thinking differently, you want to be in another movie. It's like an addiction almost.

author: Sissy Spacek
text: My cousin, Rip Torn, persuaded me not to change my name. You shouldn't change what you are in the search for success.

author: Sidney Buchman
text: I have seen the face of this country change in 25 years or 30 years. I have seen a equalization begin to develop - in inheritance laws, tax laws, laws for favoring trade unions, protecting them, and so forth. All these are social changes.

author: Chuck Palahniuk
text: If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character, would you slow down? Or speed up?

author: Burt Shavitz
text: There are so many opportunities to see the sun go down in the evening and the sun come up in the morning. The colors change on the trees, on the snow. I'm surrounded by people who are friendly and helpful.

author: Naveen Jain
text: In the business world today, failure is apparently not an option. We need to change this attitude toward failure - and celebrate the idea that only by falling on our collective business faces do we learn enough to succeed down the road.

author: David Mixner
text: Politics was put in front of me. I do politics because it's the vehicle for change and because I happen to be good at it... I had this sort of calm fearlessness, that some would call foolishness.

author: Peter Coyote
text: It came home to me indelibly that I was never going to change anything in America by walking around carrying a sign. It was a great revelation. It saved me a lot of anxiety and a lot of wasted energy.

author: William J. Clinton
text: If you believe in making change from the bottom up, if you believe the measure of change is how many people's lives are better, you know it's hard, and some people think it's boring.

author: Mary Douglas
text: If you want to change the culture, you will have to start by changing the organization.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
text: Favor comes because for a brief moment in the great space of human change and progress some general human purpose finds in him a satisfactory embodiment.

author: Max Muller
text: While the river of life glides along smoothly, it remains the same river; only the landscape on either bank seems to change.

author: Jason Reitman
text: When characters change on screen, it makes you feel better about yourself. You think, 'Oh I change too, I'm constantly becoming a better person.'

author: Dave Morris
text: As we get older, we demand stories that go somewhere. Things must change.

author: Robert Friedland
text: Our group has been in Asia since 1981 in mining, oil and gas. Now we want to mine not silver and gold, but great stories and people, and change the world of cinema, and we want to do that by walking in the footsteps of Wu Tianming.

author: Mario Balotelli
text: Racist people are few, in the minority. But you can do nothing to change them. You can talk, you can do what you want, but you can't do anything because they are just stupid people.

author: Ethan Canin
text: No matter what writers say, most stories are about ourselves. The facts might change a little, but not much.

author: Greg Rucka
text: Comics fans want new stuff that looks exactly like the old stuff. It is hard for the publishers, and even the audience, to change something.

author: Alicia Witt
text: Acting is magical. Change your look and your attitude, and you can be anyone.

author: Ron Conway
text: As the tech industry continues to grow and sprout successful startups across the country, it is important that we understand our responsibility to affect positive change in our communities.

author: Josh Malerman
text: I didn't sleep much in the summer of '98. Was getting ready to move to New York City. Start a band. That was a madman's summer. A summer of change.

author: Marvin Ammori
text: Without the ability to criticize unjust laws in powerful symbolic ways, we can't change them. And the point of a democracy is that people should be able to convince other people to change a law.

author: Sophie Winkleman
text: I was going to change my name to Sophie Windsor, but then I decided not to. I prefer to go into the room just as Sophie Winkleman.

author: Vanessa Kerry
text: I think there is a generation gap. I personally look forward to, as our generation becomes the leaders, you are gonna see a change, and I think hopefully gay marriage will be a part of that country.

author: Octavio Paz
text: Changes in our aesthetic tastes have no value or meaning in and of themselves; what has value and meaning is the idea of change itself. Or, better stated: not change in and of itself, but change as an agent or inspiration of modern creations.

author: Steve Easterbrook
text: What I've looked to do is try and become a change agent for good, to create the behavioral changes, the cultural changes to really embrace urgency, adopt a higher tolerance to risk, and just encourage people to make decisions.

author: Mario Batali
text: Finishing food is about the tiny touches. In the last seconds you can change everything.

author: Joe Lando
text: There's an old saying, this too shall pass, and change is good.

author: Hugo Black
text: The Framers of the Constitution knew that free speech is the friend of change and revolution. But they also knew that it is always the deadliest enemy of tyranny.

author: Michael Phelps
text: I want to test my maximum and see how much I can do. And I want to change the world of swimming.

author: Sam Worthington
text: Well, I think the world changes around you - I think you don't change. That's as simple as that.

author: Danica Patrick
text: The commitments, schedule and sponsor appearances don't change. It gets more busy, because you get more popular, and the more popular you are, it actually gets more busy. They're like, 'Yeah, let's use her, she's hot right now. Let's do a shoot!'

author: John Sayles
text: I made it about a three-day weekend so people wouldn't have to change their clothes a lot. We didn't have an art department; we didn't have a make-up department.

author: Rajeev Shukla
text: People change their opinion according to your position. And both politicians and bureaucrats begin to take you more seriously, as they suddenly feel you have become more important.

author: Chuck Palahniuk
text: Since change is constant, you wonder if people crave death because it's the only way they can get anything really finished.

author: Jenny Shipley
text: Too often the desire for peace has been expressed by women while the stewardship of the mechanisms which are used to attempt to secure peace in the short and medium term are dominated by male decision-making structures and informal arrangements. This must change.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
text: An ideal society should be mobile, should be full of channels for conveying a change taking place in one part to other parts. In an ideal society, there should be many interests consciously communicated and shared.

author: Gary Hamel
text: You can't build an adaptable organization without adaptable people - and individuals change only when they have to, or when they want to.

author: Jody Watley
text: There's one more thing I want to say. It's a touchy subject. Black beauty. Black sensuality. We live in a culture where the beauty of black people isn't always as celebrated as other types. I'd like to help change that if I can!

author: Frank Herbert
text: The stakes in conflict do not change. Battle determines who will control the wealth or its equivalent.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: Are creeds such simple things like the clothes which a man can change at will and put on at will? Creeds are such for which people live for ages and ages.

author: Keke Palmer
text: As you age, you start to realize that your emotions are in your hands and not someone else's. Once you put them in someone else's hands, that's when you give them the power, and you can't change it. Only they can change it.

author: Buffy Sainte-Marie
text: We also have the option of scanning in an image from outside the computer... a photo, or a sketch done with traditional tools; and we can then paint, manipulate, process, change, and further develop the image within the computer, watching our progress on the monitor.

author: Gina McCarthy
text: Greenhouse gas pollution, through its contribution to global climate change, presents a significant threat to Americans' health and to the environment upon which our economy and security depends.

author: Nikki Giovanni
text: A lot of people resist transition and therefore never allow themselves to enjoy who they are. Embrace the change, no matter what it is; once you do, you can learn about the new world you're in and take advantage of it.

author: Niki Taylor
text: My greatest life lesson has been that life can change in a second. This is why it's important to always live your best possible life and to do what you can for others.

author: Kathleen Quinlan
text: When not much is happening and there seems to be nothing you can do to change that, you do wonder. But I am an actor, like it or not. I stuck with it and took what was offered.

author: Louis R. Chenevert
text: The need for air transport is real, and it's not going to change. The key is to have the right business model and have the right initiatives, in my view, to succeed.

author: Tom Brady
text: We all have experiences in our lives that change us, and we all learn from people, like my dad, but at the end of the day, it's only us. And we're only responsible to make ourselves happy.

author: Ginni Rometty
text: Every part of your business will change based on what I consider predictive analytics of the future.

author: Pratibha Patil
text: Financial institutions, the corporate world and civil society - all must uphold high standards of probity in their working. Only a genuine partnership between the Government and its people can bring about positive change to create a just society.

author: Heather Brooke
text: You can't hope for a better result as a campaigner than to have the prime minister announce a major policy change within 48 hours of your documentary.

author: Gloria Steinem
text: We are still behaving as if a worker really doesn't have a family because the work pattern really was meant for men who really were the financial support but weren't looking after their families. We need to change this, and we can easily do that.

author: Michael Ashcroft
text: We spent too much time attacking Gordon Brown and Labour rather than setting out our own plans. People had decided they wanted change - the thing they were not sure about was the alternative we were offering, so going on and on about Labour missed the point.

author: Gordon Brown
text: Take, therefore, what modern technology is capable of: the power of our moral sense allied to the power of communications and our ability to organize internationally. That, in my view, gives us the first opportunity as a community to fundamentally change the world.

author: Thandie Newton
text: If I could change my appearance, I would have the gap between my front teeth put back in.

author: George Strait
text: I'm a country singer. I love all kinds of music, but country is where my loyalty lies. That's just me and what I do, and I'm not going to change it.

author: Billy Casper
text: I learned something very important early on: You accept what happens and move on. In other words, if I hit a bad shot, I can't change it. There is only the next shot. That was a big lesson.

author: Bindi Irwin
text: Thrilled to be part of this new project Generation Nature and just encouraging kids to change the world.

author: Miuccia Prada
text: Every day I'm thinking about change.

author: Cal Thomas
text: In a free society, government reflects the soul of its people. If people want change at the top, they will have to live in different ways. Our major social problems are not the cause of our decadence. They are a reflection of it.

author: Kendrick Lamar
text: My moms always told me, 'How long you gonna play the victim?' I can say I'm mad and I hate everything, but nothing really changes until I change myself.

author: John Monks
text: The best performers in Europe are those who use their welfare states to help people adjust to change.

author: S. Jay Olshansky
text: Fixing obesity is going to require a change in our modern relationship with food. I'm hopeful that we begin to see a turnaround in this childhood obesity epidemic.

author: Roland Gift
text: I think I'm actually quite a materialistic person, I value what it takes to make a car or build a nice house. Money does change things, but how it changes people depends on how they react to it.

author: Marie Osmond
text: There are some great questions to ask your doctor. If he says 'no,' then you find yourself a different doctor. There really has to be a change in how we medically look at women at this time. I mean, this is not just baby gloom.

author: Sergei Lavrov
text: Shouldn't the General Assembly adopt a declaration on the inadmissibility of interference into domestic affairs of sovereign states and nonrecognition of coup d'etats as a method of the change of power?

author: Jessica Mitford
text: You may not be able to change the world, but at least you can embarrass the guilty.

author: John Conyers
text: Every few generations there are people who come along that change the way we look at the world, for musical enthusiasts Monk is one of these individuals.

author: Richard Kiel

text: Dogs and other animals - goats, donkeys, cows, a grumpy rooster - continue to change my writing life.

author: Diane Arbus
text: Men are but children of a larger growth, Our appetites as apt to change as theirs, And full as craving too, and full as vain.

author: Tori Amos
text: Our generation has an incredible amount of realism, yet at the same time it loves to complain and not really change. Because, if it does change, then it won't have anything to complain about.

author: Meek Mill
text: I don't think I would change really anything about rap. Rap don't have no limits to it, and I like it like that.

author: Patricia Polacco
text: I don't believe being gay is something you can change, no more than you can change the color of your hair or your eyes. Well, I dye my hair, so maybe that's not the best example. But your eyes!

author: Henri Nouwen
text: Ministers are powerless people who have nothing to boast of except their weaknesses. But when the Lord whom they serve fills them with His blessing they will move mountains and change the hearts of people wherever they go.

author: Sebastian Pinera
text: Life is tough - and you have to be tougher than life to change the world.

author: Barbara Johnson
text: No one likes change but babies in diapers.

author: Ban Ki-moon
text: Climate change is destroying our path to sustainability. Ours is a world of looming challenges and increasingly limited resources. Sustainable development offers the best chance to adjust our course.

author: Ernst Fischer
text: In a decaying society, art, if it is truthful, must also reflect decay. And unless it wants to break faith with its social function, art must show the world as changeable. And help to change it.

author: Vicente Fox
text: Mexico doesn't deserve what has happened to us. A democratic change is urgent, a change that will permit us to stop being a loser country.

author: Holly Black
text: I am not very good at sticking to outlines, and I double back all the time to revisit scenes and change things.

author: Soleil Moon Frye
text: I want kids to know that it is okay to make a change in order to feel better about themselves.

author: Andrew Lo
text: The adaptive markets hypothesis says that all economic institutions, like our own species, develop and change over time, depending on the population of investors that are engaged with them.

author: Mike Nichols
text: A great thing is happening on cable TV. You see characters change in stories over years, like in Tolstoy. That's a whole, thrilling new form that I really enjoy. They are Tolstoy-an in their endless character development and narrative changes... a show like 'Breaking Bad' is astonishing.

author: Martha Beck
text: My point is that perceptual bias can affect nut jobs and scientists alike. If we hold too rigidly to what we think we know, we ignore or avoid evidence of anything that might change our mind.

author: Marshall Herskovitz
text: Even those who don't believe in climate change believe we should develop renewable energy. Americans get it: it's time. This is not controversial. It's actually right in the wheelhouse of American business.

text: Going into the second arc, I'm making a conscious effort to do something I say I never do, which is to change my style because of feedback. I'm trying to make 'Pretty Deadly' more accessible by being more clear in the writing.

author: Steve Jobs
text: Things don't have to change the world to be important.

author: Rush Limbaugh
text: Liberalism isn't change. It has to be imposed.

author: Dwyane Wade
text: Wherever you go, things change you. I mean, obviously moving to Miami and becoming part of the NBA has given me a different perspective on style than I had when I lived in Chicago or Milwaukee.

author: Pope Francis
text: There is a need for financial reform along ethical lines that would produce in its turn an economic reform to benefit everyone. This would nevertheless require a courageous change of attitude on the part of political leaders.

author: Ivanka Trump
text: The presidency of the United States is an incredible thing. You have an ability to effectuate change at the highest level.

author: Edward McKendree Bounds
text: The transfiguration of Jesus is one of the typical facts of the resurrection of the body; not only of the glorious change, but of the renewed life of the body and of the general judgment day.

author: Douglas Booth

author: Jeff Probst
text: The thing that surprises me most is, you cannot change who you are.

author: Hans Vestberg
text: You can always think that we're old and not innovative, but there is no company that can limp on for 139 years without being creative and having the genes to change.

author: Kristin Cavallari
text: It's very difficult to change the perception people have of you.

author: Horton Foote
text: I'm a social writer in the sense that I want to record, but not in the sense of trying to change people's minds.

author: Gordon W. Allport
text: Scarcely anyone ever wants to be anybody else. However handicapped or unhappy he feels himself, he would not change places with other more fortunate mortals.

author: Tim Cook
text: Anything can change, because the smartphone revolution is still in the early stages.

author: Hans Vestberg
text: When I came into the CEO office, I basically changed the entire management team. We knew that we had to change the company, so we needed a new set of leaders.

author: Steve Gleason
text: Does anyone know if Lamborghini makes wheelchair vehicles? If not, I want to change that.

author: Paul Ryan
text: So here's the question: Without a change in leadership, why would the next four years be any different from the last four years?

author: Jesse Jackson
text: Time is neutral and does not change things. With courage and initiative, leaders change things.

author: Peter Garrett
text: The forces that are in play on climate change essentially revolve around the generation of power, the transportation of goods and services and people, and the sorts of materials that we use to fuel the whole of our civilisation.

author: Jim DeMint

author: J. Michael Straczynski
text: If a person with a bullet in Dallas can change the world, imagine a person with an idea could do.

author: Keri Russell
text: Sometimes it's the smallest decisions that can change your life forever.

author: Steven Spielberg

text: But I think talent as a writer is hard-wired in, it's all there, at least the basic elements of it. You can't change it any more than you can choose whether to be right handed or left handed.

author: Ivan Krastev
text: As China is about adaptation, not transformation, it is unlikely to change the world dramatically should it ever assume the global driver's seat. But this does not mean that China won't exploit that world for its own purposes.

author: Dele Alli
text: My personality is that I like to express myself, and that is not something I will look to change.

author: Mary McAleese

text: You can be a catalyst for change but change never really entirely happens just because of one guy.

author: Drew Daywalt
text: In Hollywood it's really tough to change genres; you have to re-prove yourself.

author: Michael Ovitz
text: I'm interested in what's new. I'm interested in change. I'm interested in a different game in life.

author: James Nesbitt

author: Stone Gossard
text: Dave played an important part in our growing, but change occurs.

author: Jason Clarke

author: Lionel Blue
text: To change, to convert? Why bother?

author: Yuna
text: Music has to change. I don't want to stay the same forever.

author: Terezinha Guilhermina
text: I knew that if I were the best in the world, my reality could change. I was always the person who didn't conform to the idea of 'halfway.'

author: P. J. O'Rourke
text: In the language of politics, there is only one translation for the phrase 'hope and change,' to wit: 'big, fat government.'

author: David D. Burns
text: What saddens me is seeing patients who have been going to therapy for years and years with no change, but they keep going to the same therapist. To me, that's not right.

author: Nayvadius Cash
text: You make music to change the radio, not make music for the radio.

author: Foxy Brown
text: I'm willing to do whatever I need to do to change.

author: Kellyanne Conway
text: Voters go into the ballot box with big ideas in their mind: leadership, change, experience, hope.

author: David D. Burns
text: Therapy is not to 'talk about' things, but to change the person's life, and to relieve suffering, such as depression, anxiety, or relationship problems.

author: Lynn Good
text: Fracking has been a real technological change that has caused great innovation in our business, and we've had the benefit of very low gas prices for our customers as a result of that.

author: Sarah Palin
text: The challenge is not to replace Obama but with who. It's not enough to just change up the uniform, if we don't change the team and the game plan, we won't save our country.

text: People are always looking for the single magic bullet that will totally change everything. There is no single magic bullet.

text: California is an island, and New York's an island. Maybe it's time for me to change islands.

author: Lilly Pulitzer
text: Seeing Michelle Obama's bright color choices, and how she made people smile and reinforced Obama's platforms of hope and change, was inspiring.

text: Early in my career, people wanted to hear music about protest, about trying to change things.

author: Eileen Myles
text: I thought 'Chelsea Girls' was going to change my life.

author: Ivanka Trump
text: You really don't need to study how to change a diaper. As a new mom, you learn pretty darn quickly!

text: You are not going to change me and if you do, it will look like a fraud, it will be a fraud.

text: Franklin Roosevelt was a great leader. He saw how to use the levers of power to affect change.

author: William Glasser
text: If you want to change attitudes, start with a change in behavior.

text: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.

text: We begin to change the world when we stimulate long-term prosperity using technology. There is not a problem that's large enough that innovation and entrepreneurship can't solve.

text: Progress is seldom simple; it comes with costs and casualties, even challenges about whether a change represents an advance or a retreat.

author: Albert Ellis
text: People got insights into what was bothering them, but they hardly did a damn thing to change.

author: William Arthur Ward
text: Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings.

author: Ambrose Bierce
text: Revolution, n. In politics, an abrupt change in the form of misgovernment.

text: I do think that we are facing a crisis in our democracy. As true patriots, each and every one of us has to speak up, speak out, and change those in charge. Our democracy depends upon it.

text: You've got to be who you are. You've got to be honest with people. If your views change on something, you've got to be willing to express it.

text: When people feel that something really special is happening on the stage, things change.

text: I can't just say one time of the year I'm going to do something different. I have to commit to a lifestyle behavioral change and just try to be a little bit better today than I was yesterday.

text: My mother-in-law has come round to our house at Christmas seven years running. This year we're having a change. We're going to let her in.

text: I will refine somebody in a minor way, but I don't want to totally change them. I don't want them to look like plastic dolls.

text: It is not strange... to mistake change for progress.

text: In the case of Marilyn and John Kennedy, I think they did affect change.

text: I just found over the years that it's very hard to change people's perception of what it is that you do.

text: Change is such hard work.

text: As an actor, the second and last ones were interesting for me. Because those parts had the most change in playing someone who was both light and dark, sort of Jekyl and Hyde.

text: Places change over time with or without oil spills, but humans are responsible for the Deepwater Horizon gusher - and humans, as well as the corals, fish and other creatures, are suffering the consequences.

text: I've seen firsthand that being president doesn't change who you are. It reveals who you are.

text: Punk was more based on social change than on music, so it didn't bother me too much. It wasn't really a musical threat.

text: Markets change, tastes change, so the companies and the individuals who choose to compete in those markets must change.

text: Working on the film really made me confront my opinions about change and gentrification.

text: For reasons we don't have to get into, climate change has become an incredibly polarized issue in the United States. I think that is sad. My own personal view is that we're in a planetary emergency such has not been seen in 600,000 years.

text: I have worked steadily since I started, but things are very hard for women and need to change.

text: Business has to change the way it does business, or we will make no significant changes in the way we relate to the earth.

text: I had hoped all of Congress would recognize that it is imperative for our health, economy, and national security that we address the effects of climate change before they get even worse.

text: The last couple of years I've been on an empty tank. And that's gotta change.

text: You don't change minds in Washington with sweet reason. You do it to the white light of public opinion.

text: I would say that Barack Obama has always been a real optimist about what can be accomplished. He believes that government can be used to create systemic, long-term, real change. And the first lady is more of a skeptic.

text: The politicians always told us that the Cold War stand-off could only change by way of nuclear war. None of them believed that such systemic change was possible.

author: Francis Maude
text: If we want to change what people think of us, then we have got to change.

text: I was broke for more than 10 years. I remember staying up all night one night at my first company and looking in couch cushions the next morning for some change to buy coffee.

text: Each major wave of technology innovation has given rise to one or more super-unicorns - companies that could change your life to work at or invest in if you're not lucky/genius enough to be a co-founder.

author: Yehuda Berg
text: Change is inevitable. Things absolutely cannot stay the same. The type of change we invoke is up to each and every one of us.

text: Maybe in music you're making an auditory environment and maybe you change your environment around you to suit your own way.

text: The years I raced in were fantastic. There was so much change in the cars. We went from treaded tyres to no wings right through to slicks to enormous wings.

author: John Edgar Wideman
text: Real change is always violent, but it may hurt a lot less than what's in place before the violence occurs.

author: David Attenborough
text: Many individuals are doing what they can. But real success can only come if there is a change in our societies and in our economics and in our politics.

author: Chuck Palahniuk
text: Find joy in everything you choose to do. Every job, relationship, home... it's your responsibility to love it, or change it.

author: Jejomar Binay
text: Jojo Binay will not change.

author: Kenneth Chenault
text: I had very little exposure to business growing up. I also was very focused on the Civil Rights Movement. And I saw law as a vehicle to really bring about substantial change.

author: Ron DeSantis
text: The idea that we have the capacity to change or stop the climate, I'm just skeptical.

author: Ashton Kutcher
text: I could never be with a woman who felt like she needed to change me.

author: Elizabeth Warren
text: I don't want to go to Washington to be a co-sponsor of some bland little bill nobody cares about. I don't want to go to Washington to get my name on something that makes small change at the margin.

author: Nandan Nilekani
text: My background is putting in large systems that change lives... The right kind of systems can bring honesty and efficiency.

author: Gordon Bethune
text: It all sounds almost silly, but the fact is that the only way to change a corporate culture is to just change it.

author: Yvon Chouinard
text: I believe the accepted model of capitalism that demands endless growth deserves the blame for the destruction of nature, and it should be displaced. Failing that, I try to work with those companies and help them change the way they think about our resources.

author: A. R. Ammons
text: That's a wonderful change that's taken place, and so most poetry today is published, if not directly by the person, certainly by the enterprise of the poet himself, working with his friends.

author: Uday Kotak
text: It is possible that the digital world may change the need for physical branches. We will continue to add branches incrementally, but we will reach a point - whether it is 1,500, 1,800 or 2,000 branches - where we will say enough is enough.

author: Mikhail Gorbachev
text: I couldn't wait to get to the most powerful position, because I thought then I would be able to fix problems that only the leader can fix. But when I got there, I realized we needed revolutionary change.

author: Bertolt Brecht
text: Because things are the way they are, things will not stay the way they are.

author: River Phoenix
text: I can't on my own change the regime in South Africa or teach the Palestinians to learn to live with the Israelies, but I can start with me.

author: Joel Osteen
text: Just because something didn't work out your way, or somebody disappointed you, that does not change who you are.

author: Donald Knuth
text: Let us change our traditional attitude to the construction of programs. Instead of imagining that our main task is to instruct a computer what to do, let us concentrate rather on explaining to human beings what we want a computer to do.

author: Joseph Barber Lightfoot
text: But on the other hand, while disclaiming any change in my opinions, I desire equally to disclaim the representations of those opinions which have been put forward in some quarters.

author: Cynthia Kenyon
text: It's possible that we could change a human gene and double our life span. I don't know if that's true, but we can't rule that out.

author: Juan Diego Florez
text: Even if change in a voice is light, and people maybe don't notice it, that slight change is, for singers, a bit of an earthquake.

author: Seth Berkley
text: When it comes to providing aid, developing innovations, and making bold steps that change the course of history, the United States is usually on the front lines.

author: Jules Shear
text: A person like Carole King could make up something, change it, and actually improve it.

author: Virginia Postrel
text: Like John Kennedy in 1960, Obama combines youth, vigor, and good looks with the promise of political change. Like Kennedy, he grew up in unusual circumstances that distance him from ordinary American life.

author: Hilary Mantel
text: If you skew the endocrine system, you lose the pathways to self. When endocrine patterns change, it alters the way you think and feel. One shift in the pattern tends to trip another.

author: Stuart Wilde
text: If you don't change, reality in the end forces that change upon you.

author: Laurent Brancowitz
text: It's a great honor when somebody takes your song and does something different with it. That's what music is all about: to constantly change what somebody else has done.

author: Samantha Morton
text: What shocks me is that so many people leave care and become homeless, and when you're homeless you get into crime, prostitution and drugs, and it is a vicious circle. That's what we need to change.

author: Deanna Raybourn
text: It sounds ghoulish, but it would have been fascinating to be in Paris in 1789 and watch the revolution begin. I can't even imagine what the energy must have been like that year with all of that change crackling in the air.

author: Robert Bridges
text: So sweet love seemed that April morn. When first we kissed beside the thorn, So strangely sweet, it was not strange We thought that love could never change.

author: Louis Sachar
text: I didn't become a good writer until I learned how to rewrite. And I don't just mean fixing spelling and adding a comma. I rewrite each of my books five or six times, and each time I change huge portions of the story.

author: John Lilly
text: Our only security is our ability to change.

author: Timothy Geithner
text: I think we're not going to preserve Fannie and Freddie in anything like their current form. We're going to have to bring fundamental change to that market.

text: Generational change within a genre is hard to parse while it's happening. Only in retrospect can the passing of the baton from ancestors to progeny be clearly discerned.

text: The only people who can fix Africa are talented young Africans. By unlocking and nurturing their creative potential, we can create a step change in Africa's future.

text: We are all born with a unique genetic blueprint, which lays out the basic characteristics of our personality as well as our physical health and appearance... And yet, we all know that life experiences do change us.

author: Hillary Clinton
text: Look at climate change; don't put your head in the sand. Understand that it is going to have profound effects on our resources and so much else.

author: Peter Lindbergh
text: Fashion is about change, don't you think?

author: Gordon Brown
text: The growing evidence of climate change is forcing attention on carbon emissions and their reduction.

author: Peter Singer
text: When fish experience something that would cause other animals physical pain, they behave in ways suggestive of pain, and the change in behaviour may last several hours.

author: Shukla Bose

author: Nathaniel Branden

text: Americans are hungry for change both at home and in our relations with the rest of the world.

text: I hated the reflection in the mirror. I wanted so much to be someone else... I thought that if I was thinner, the rest of my life would change.

author: C. L. R. James

text: I see a lot of people who change careers in the middle of their life and they think it's a good idea to come in the kitchen.

author: Henry Rollins

author: Lauren Hutton

author: Swizz Beatz

author: Steven Pinker
text: Photography is a demanding action sport. The light can change so quickly. I often find myself sprinting so that I can catch the perfect light falling on a photogenic subject.

author: Martin O'Malley
text: Climate change is transforming the world in profound ways that continue to evolve.

text: One of the problems of writing and working and looking at the Internet is that it's very hard to separate fashion from deep change.

author: Dirk Benedict
text: Change is good. And in fact unavoidable.

text: We are afraid of ideas, of experimenting, of change. We shrink from thinking a problem through to a logical conclusion.

text: There has been a change in men's attitudes toward their clothes. Men are more aware of fashion; they're not afraid of it.

text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.

text: Our relationship with Egypt is very, very important. And I would want them to remain an ally. I don't want to see that official status change.

text: In football, the good thing is things can change in a second.

text: We are entering an era of heightened disaster, thanks to climate change. Being prepared for disaster will mean being prepared to sift truth from rumour, and being prepared to adjust our worldview.

text: Some people will never change.

text: If you have twenty guys in the room and you just bring in one girl, you change the entire mood and everyone plays different.

text: I'm a vegetarian and change my hair color as much as I can.

text: It's a huge change for your body. You don't even want to look in the mirror after you've had a baby, because your stomach is just hanging there like a Shar-Pei.

text: Beauty: the adjustment of all parts proportionately so that one cannot add or subtract or change without impairing the harmony of the whole.

text: The only thing I can't change is the elasticity of my skin.

text: People are fed up with seeing the same thing over and over. They want a qualitative change.

text: I support basic research, which can lead to discoveries that change our world, expand our horizons and save lives.

text: Change brings opportunities. On the other hand, change can be confusing.

text: The hallmark of our times is change and acceleration, but we have to provide the history.

text: I am here to change anything. I'm here to adapt. The critieria between a yellow and red card. What is a foul and what is not.

author: John Piper
text: Whether sexual orientation can change or not, hearts can change and turn any sexual orientation into an occasion for the glory of Christ. Those with same-sex attraction glorify Christ through sexual abstinence and through the enrichment of significant Christ-exalting relationships in other ways.

text: Have I ever written anything that has really changed something? What I believe is that you can't change anything without using art. I believe that the drops wear away the stone. I try to be part of that army.

text: If we are to change America, we must change the United States Congress.

text: Brands must empower their community to be change agents in their own right. To that end, they need to take on a mentoring role. This means the brand provides the tools, techniques and strategies for their customers to become more effective marketers in achieving their own goals.

text: The travel book is a convenient metaphor for life, with its optimistic beginning or departure, its determined striving, and its reflective conclusion. Journeys change travellers just as a good travel book can change readers.

author: Francis Picabia
text: If you want to have clean ideas, change them as often as your shirt.

author: Debbie Stabenow
text: Climate change is very real.

author: Dan Lipinski
text: Yet, despite our many advances, our environment is still threatened by a range of problems, including global climate change, energy dependence on unsustainable fossil fuels, and loss of biodiversity.

text: One of my dreams was to change the way women of color were seen on television.

author: Samantha Power
text: I've been a war reporter and a human rights defender. A professor and a columnist. A diplomat and - by far most thrillingly - a mother. And what I've learned from all these experiences is that any change worth making is going to be hard. Period.

author: Carmen Kass
text: I don't think Estonians ever really hated Russians. It was more, 'Leave us alone.' We can't change what is past. We can't blame them for what their parents have done. We never hated them. They didn't destroy us that bad.

author: Mitt Romney
text: This is the America that I love. This is a great people. We can do anything. We can achieve anything. We've got a government that has gotten in the way of the American people. We're going to change that in November.

author: Cary Fowler
text: At the Global Crop Diversity Trust, we work to conserve the diversity that will allow the adaptation and evolution of our agricultural crops in the context of climate change and other challenges.

author: Claude Chabrol
text: As far as I was concerned, either I was a homosexual or I wasn't, so making films would change nothing.

author: Kevin Systrom
text: If it's one thing we do really well as a company, it's that we take big change slowly and deliberately and bring the community along with us.

author: Leonard Orr
text: Personal law is simply the thought that controls your mind and your life more than any other thought. Finding that thought is the most valuable knowledge that you can have about yourself. It is like the leverage on personal change. It enables you to change very efficiently.

author: Thomas Hardy
text: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.

author: Per Petterson
text: A lot can change because you are embarrassed by something.

author: Edward de Bono
text: Studies have shown that 90% of error in thinking is due to error in perception. If you can change your perception, you can change your emotion and this can lead to new ideas.

author: Tom Waits
text: I don't know if any genuine, meaningful change could ever result from a song. It's kind of like throwing peanuts at a gorilla.

author: Gary Bauer
text: I have no problem with any gay group that says they're Republicans, but I will fight them tooth and nail if they try to change what the Republican Party believes.

author: Kenny Scharf
text: Part of what I do and what I want to do is I want to bring art into the everyday life. If you can take ordinary just walking in the street and you're confronted by something, that might change your day - it might inspire you.

text: My parents' divorce made an important change in my life. It affected me. After that, when I can't play Wimbledon, it was tough. For one month I was outside the world.

author: Veerappa Moily
text: If I can save 25 billion dollars in terms of reduction of import, I will be adding one percent to the GDP. By conserving the oil energy by the people, the GDP will become 5.5 percent, and this will change the economy of the country.

author: Elliott Abrams
text: I just don't understand how Kerry or Obama or anybody else thought Assad was going to change.

author: Graham Joyce
text: If critics of 'readable fiction' want literature to change the ways people dream, they need first to come down from the mountain and speak to the people.

author: Bill Gates
text: Climate change is a terrible problem, and it absolutely needs to be solved. It deserves to be a huge priority.

author: Jeff Goodell
text: Geoengineering - the deliberate, large-scale manipulation of the earth's climate to offset global warming - is a nightmare fix for climate change.

author: Bob Balaban
text: And I think being a good director is being able to be completely tyrannical and you've got to be an absolute dictator while at the same time, you have to listen and see everything because it can all change on a dime.

author: Olivia Wilde
text: You're going to change as you grow older, and that messes up a lot of relationships.

author: Ferran Adria
text: I don't worry about the things I can't change.

author: Rahm Emanuel
text: The American people... want change. They want big ideas, big reform.

text: During my military service, I performed a sketch in which I played a flea called Max. So when critics kept misspelling my name, I decided to change it and thought, 'Ah! Max!'

author: Julius Erving
text: One of the most predictable things in life is there will be change. You are better off if you can have a say in the change. But you are ignorant or naive if you don't think there will be change, whether you want it to or not.

author: Martin Sheen
text: We (actors) don't really change the world. We reflect it... but Washington really changes the world.

author: Ian Somerhalder
text: I've never been on a TV show for more than a season and you have to continually keep it interesting and you have to keep it connected, even as you change.

author: Horace
text: A heart well prepared for adversity in bad times hopes, and in good times fears for a change in fortune.

author: Sarah Brightman
text: I just wanted a change. My hair started hurting my back, so I went to my hairdresser and said 'Take it off.' And I'm delighted with the results.

text: Climate change is a global problem. The planet is warming because of the growing level of greenhouse gas emissions from human activity. text: Climate change is obviously happening and there is obviously a man-made contribution.

text: I have to struggle to change people's perceptions of me. I grew very frustrated with the perception that I'm this shy, retiring, inhibited aristocratic creature when I'm absolutely not like that at all. I think I'm much more outgoing and exuberant than my image.

author: Liz Tuccillo
text: Books are really fun because your 'voice' is pretty undiluted. There is a very direct connection between yourself and your audience. You will have an editor, but their job is to help you clarify or improve your voice, not change it.

author: James O'Shaughnessy
text: It seems that the one thing that doesn't change is people's reaction to short-term conditions and their axiomatic ability to perpetuate them far into the future.

author: Tori Amos
text: I think having a child can really change you if you're open to it.

author: Peter Carey
text: One has to be able to twist and change and distort characters, play with them like clay, so everything fits together. Real people don't permit you to do that.

author: Jean Pigozzi
text: For me to be pompous is the most horrible thing in the world. It's like putting a wall around you. It screws you up. You'd better be willing to change your views or adapt and be modern.

author: Larry Page
text: Many leaders of big organizations, I think, don't believe that change is possible. But if you look at history, things do change, and if your business is static, you're likely to have issues.

author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
text: Heat of blood makes young people change their inclinations often, and habit makes old ones keep to theirs a great while.

author: John Motson
text: And Seaman, just like a falling oak, manages to change direction.

author: Shunryu Suzuki
text: Without accepting the fact that everything changes, we cannot find perfect composure. But unfortunately, although it is true, it is difficult for us to accept it. Because we cannot accept the truth of transience, we suffer.

author: Doris Roberts
text: You can change my mind, but you gotta work harder at it.

author: Hendrik Poinar
text: If we brought the mammoth back to Siberia, maybe that would be good for the ecosystems that are changing because of climate change.

author: Greg MacGillivray
text: Marine scientists predict that by 2050 there will be no more large fish left in the ocean if we don't change our relationship with the sea.

author: Dan Pallotta
text: It's time to stop obsessing about overhead and start focusing on progress. Change charity, and charity can change the world.

author: Marilyn Manson
text: There's no reason to change what you are, but if you're not being you, then you need to acknowledge that.

author: Alex Steffen
text: Make no mistake: Tackling climate change is vital. But to see everything through the lens of short-term CO2 reductions, letting our obsession with carbon blind us to the bigger picture, is to court catastrophe.

author: Angela Merkel
text: The question is not whether we are able to change but whether we are changing fast enough.

author: Maya Angelou
text: I'm convinced of this: Good done anywhere is good done everywhere. For a change, start by speaking to people rather than walking by them like they're stones that don't matter. As long as you're breathing, it's never too late to do some good.

author: J. B. Priestley
text: Accidents, try to change them - it's impossible. The accidental reveals man.

author: Thomas Monaghan
text: We're trying to create people that are going to change the world.

author: Colin Hay
text: I don't think I'm going to change jobs at this point.

author: William Hague
text: As far as I'm aware, everybody in the shadow cabinet accepts that there's a compelling case on climate change and a strong scientific case.

author: George M. Church
text: The best way to predict the future is to change it.

author: Maurice Jarre
text: Nowadays, if a studio assumes that his film is bad, there is always an executive that gets more nervous than usual and thinks that if they change the music, the film will become a masterpiece.

author: Robert Carlyle

author: David Coverdale
text: With all the highs and lows I've had in my life, I wouldn't change anything. So no, I don't, this is what I'm supposed to be doing.

author: Colin Firth
text: I absolutely don't care about my looks and I'm so used to them that I wouldn't change a thing. I would end up missing my defects.

author: Kajol
text: I'd say working on television is much, much tougher than films. But television has a great connect with a live audience, which is a refreshing change for us actors.

author: George Matthew Adams

author: Gary Zukav

author: Roger Daltrey

author: Charlie Hunter
text: Anyone playing with you is going to change where your direction is.

author: Chris Evans
text: I don't know any form of art or entertainment that can affect people the way movies can. I know it sounds ridiculous, but they can change your world. They can change your views.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt

author: John Hurt
text: I don't think you automatically become an enlightened person because you are a daddy. But they will change you, of course - their understanding of you puts you in a different place.

author: Rush Limbaugh
text: When you talk about change, you know what makes it really tough for people is on the one hand you've got tradition, and on the other hand you've got change; in many people's mind, change equals modernization. Tradition, however. I'm a big tradition guy.

author: Jeff Cooper
text: Pick up a rifle and you change instantly from a subject to a citizen.

author: Diane Paulus

author: Andy Stern

author: Edward Levi
text: The concept of reason itself appears as an artificial attempt to separate intellectual powers from the frustrations, emotions, and accidents which cause events; the concept of reason is viewed as facade to prevent change.

author: Gayle Tzemach Lemmon

author: Susan Estrich

text: I don't expect an overnight change of all desktops to what the US Military used to call B3 level security. And even that would not stop users from shooting themselves into the foot.

author: Larry Page
text: Especially in technology, we need revolutionary change, not incremental change.

author: Barack Obama
text: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.

author: Victoria Osteen
text: I try to listen to my children. I try to change with my children.

author: Sheryl Swoopes

author: Saul Alinsky
text: All change means disorganization of the old and organization of the new.

author: Ernest Cline

author: Charity Sunshine Tillemann-Dick

author: Dan Webster
text: Are we going to just change the personalities in the speakership? Or are we going to fundamentally transform the way we do business here in Washington, D.C.?

author: Andy Murray
text: I'm definitely open to change, but at the same time I am quite stubborn.

author: Soren Kierkegaard

author: Harri Holkeri
text: In international or national crises, there are always questions of lack of confidence. You have to change the minds of the people in order to get results.

author: Tom Peters
text: For the blue-collar worker, the driving force behind change was factory automation using programmable machine tools. For the office worker, it's office automation using computer technology: enterprise-resource-planning systems, groupware, intranets, extranets, expert systems, the Web, and e-commerce.

author: Julianna Margulies
text: If you walk down the street and smile at someone, that will get passed on to the next person. That has the power to change someone's day.

author: Sonny Mehta
text: The Pakistani writers are addressing change and what's happening today in the world. There is something completely contemporary in this writing.

author: Chade-Meng Tan
text: If I can turn the most powerful part of the world into a land of wisdom and compassion, it's going to change the rest of the world.

author: Bela Lugosi
text: The vampire was a complete change from the usual romantic characters I was playing, but it was a success.

text: I used to change things in my early paintings to get the nuance or feeling I wanted, but now I plan everything in my head before I do it.

author: Star Jones
text: One day I actually took the list into the bathroom and I put it up against my face and looked in the mirror and I realized I had one of two choices, change the list or change myself.

author: Scott Kelly
text: It's for us to take care of the air we breathe and the water we drink. And I do believe we have an impact on that, and we do have the ability to change it if we make the decision to.

text: Is it 10 years, 20, 50 before we reach that tipping point where climate change becomes irreversible? Nobody can know. There's clearly a probability distribution. We need to ensure this planet, and we need to do it quickly.

author: Leon Askin

text: Redemption just means you just make a change in your life and you try to do right, versus what you were doing, which was wrong.

author: Clare Short
text: I have set out to change the language of the international system.

text: We accept the world in order to change it. If you do not accept, then what are you going to change?

author: Al Gore
text: A zebra does not change its spots.

text: Incarceration didn't change me. In many ways, incarceration galvanized me. The totality of the experience helped me.

author: Paul Watson
text: Social change comes through people.

text: If you live in a ghetto and really want not to just change your life and your family's life but change your ghetto's life, make your ghetto a good neighbourhood, learn science; try to be like Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and Steve Jobs.

text: So you start one person at a time. Change one person, you can change a village.

text: The U.S. news media have a critical role to play in educating the public about climate change.

author: Dorothy Denning
text: The concern is over what will happen as strong encryption becomes commonplace with all digital communications and stored data. Right now the use of encryption isn't all that widespread, but that state of affairs is expected to change rapidly.

text: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.

text: On a human level, people want to see someone succeed who wants to change.

text: You are not going to change the minds of people who are looking for attention.

text: If you take different mythologies from different cultures, the names may change and the story lines may vary but there is always something in common.

text: With 100 million people, somebody is using your product in some interesting way. If you change it... you're going to break some use cases.

In the ozone depletion case, we managed to work with decision makers effectively so that an international agreement called the Montreal Protocol was achieved that essentially solved the ozone depletion problem.

text: States seem to have a natural life cycle, and anything can occur to change them into something else, and that something might be no bad thing.

author: bell hooks
text: Once you do away with the idea of people as fixed, static entities, then you see that people can change, and there is hope.

author: Sasha Grey
text: Persistence and determination are incredibly important. But sometimes you need to analyze the situation and understand when you're wrong. You need to be able to cop to being wrong, learn to change, and continue to grow as a human being.

text: We can choose food that doesn't lead to illnesses like diabetes and cancer. We can choose food that doesn't contribute to water pollution and climate change. And we can choose food that keeps local economies vibrant and farmers on their land.

text: Having done 'Misfits' for three years solid, you become known for doing one thing, so I've wanted to change things up as much as possible with each job.

text: Incredibly, oil and gas companies don't have to pay certain environmental costs that amount to small change to them, while an offshore wind project start-up is faced with fees that could mean the difference between building a wind farm and packing up and going home.

text: When you have that window of opportunity called a crisis, move as quickly as you can, get as much done as you can. There's a momentum for change that's very compelling.

author: Shirley Manson
text: I am a contradictory mess but I see it as my prerogative to change my mood like the weather.

text: Things alter for the worse spontaneously, if they be not altered for the better designedly.

author: Ken Mehlman
text: Conservatives don't need to change core convictions to embrace the growing support for equal rights for gay Americans.

author: Michelle Obama
text: A candidate is not going to suddenly change once they get into office. Just the opposite, in fact. Because the minute that individual takes that oath, they are under the hottest, harshest light there is. And there is no way to hide who they really are.

author: Peter Marshall
text: Lord, where we are wrong, make us willing to change; where we are right, make us easy to live with.

text: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.

author: David Bohm
text: People are no longer primarily in opposition, nor can they be said to be interacting, rather they are participating in this pool of common meaning which is capable of constant development and change.

author: Marge Piercy
text: Never doubt that you can change history. You already have.

author: Ingrid Newkirk
